meanings.definition: Throw forcefully in a specified direction.
meanings.sent1: He cast the ball towards the goal with all his might.
meanings.sent2: She cast her fishing line into the lake to catch some fish.
meanings.sent3: The magician cast a spell on the audience, making them all laugh uncontrollably.
meanings.sent4: The storm clouds cast a shadow over the entire town, signaling the impending rain.
meanings.sent5: The blacksmith would cast molten metal into intricate shapes to create beautiful jewelry.

meanings.definition: An object made by shaping metal or other material in a mold.
meanings.sent1: The artist displayed a beautiful bronze cast of a lion in the gallery.
meanings.sent2: She admired the intricate details of the metal cast of a flower.
meanings.sent3: The children used a sandcastle mold to create a perfect sand cast of a castle.
meanings.sent4: The archaeologist carefully examined the ancient cast of a Roman coin.
meanings.sent5: The museum showcased a collection of casts of famous sculptures from around the world.

meanings.definition: The actors taking part in a play, movie, or other production.
meanings.sent1: The cast of the new movie includes famous actors from Hollywood.
meanings.sent2: She was excited to meet the cast of her favorite TV show at the fan event.
meanings.sent3: The cast of the school play rehearsed their lines diligently every day.
meanings.sent4: The director was impressed by the talent of the entire cast during auditions.
meanings.sent5: The theater announced the cast list for the upcoming musical production.

meanings.sent1: She gave him a suspicious cast as he tried to explain his absence.
meanings.sent2: He had a habit of looking at people with a slight cast in his eyes.
meanings.sent3: The comedian exaggerated a funny cast in his eyes to make the audience laugh.
meanings.sent4: The old man's cast made him appear wise and contemplative.
meanings.sent5: Her cast gave her a mysterious and enigmatic look that intrigued others.
